intro: Thlaspi huteri, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its rosette growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Thlaspi huteri typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually fleshy and covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in harsh climates.
